channel.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
channel.description:
It's my bedroom btw. Something I've been working on for like a week now actually, not constantly, but yeah, only now decided to post it as I feel I've gone into a fair amount of detail. All geometry was by me, all measured accurately, even the wall thickness, although you can't really see that in the pictures. Yes that's the same gibson I done a while ago, just added it in to spice it up a little.
Modelled in 3ds max rendered in vray.
Right, I'm mainly looking for criticism on geometry, and what to do next. I haven't set it up for rendering yet, there is just one light, so I don't particularly need comments on the realism.
Need advice on what to do with the window too. :/
ps. the shirt will look shit atm, I've only today learnt how to mess around with the cloth modifier, and I was just doing it somewhat as a small test to see how well it can work. (and to practice my character modelling a little :P )
To do:
[ul][li]Model a light fitting in the roof[/li] [li]Model my radiator[/li] [li]Model my bin[/li] [li]Model my laptop, maybe[/li] [li]Model the bed mattress and covers[/li] [li]Finish off the window area, including curtains[/li] [li]Map all the wood again to look realistic, and so seams are not visible[/li] [li]Add lights appropriately and prepare for rendering[/li][/ul]
[IMG]http://img6.imageshack.us/img6/78/interiordesign21.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img651.imageshack.us/img651/9246/interiordesign22.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img24.imageshack.us/img24/4834/interiordesign23.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img36.imageshack.us/img36/3150/interiordesign25.png[/img]

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

badger41:

i think you should work on/remove the shirt… it looks as if its made of paper(super stiff)

Yeep, I’ve removed it now if you check the very last picture.
It was the first thing I’d ever done anything like that and was just using it as a test to see how it’d react to the desk.

Read full topic

Does it? That’s what it looks like irl.
[/quote]

I like how your guitar magically got ‘upgraded’ in the scene. :)[/quote]

Hah, yeah, haven’t got round to actually modelling my acoustic, so I thought I’d just shove in my gibson.
I’m planning on adding some wall mounts for the guitars sometime anyway, then just model about 3 of them, I enjoy modelling guitars more than anything so.

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Turn off GI and look at your lighting and see how it looks. Only add GI at the end.

Also, make sure and use a physical camera with the sun. If you don’t understand cameras, uncheck the exposure tickbox under the options though.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yea, I’m starting to lose motivation now, it got so bad I had to make some little thing on the desk, can see it in the new picture, it was surprisingly easy, only took about 5 minutes.

Do you have any ideas on my problem above?

I still find guitars the most fun, always have done.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I cant stand making rooms. First i make like 30% of it and it looks bad because it feels empty but i start to lose motivation and end up not adding all the things that would make it more realistic. Which is why i switched to game art.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

SomethingToHide:

This entire thread reminds me of my bathroom thread. A lot.

LOl: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,308930.msg2469153.html#msg2469153
Yeah, the way you wrote the paragraphs at the start and everything, haha.
Except yours kicks ass.

Ps. guys, why does this happen when I add a vray sun light?
http://img689.imageshack.us/img689/7548/interiordesign26.png

I want it to shine in through the window and create a nice shadow on the desk somewhere, it’s just lighted the whole place up.
It’s been placed very high up in the sky, and pretty far away from the window, intensity is at 0.45.
I swear there are next to no good tutorials for using a sun for interior.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Bedroom scene
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:2, topic:348840”]Shitty room, but pretty nice graphics job. Well done.

But I gotta say…that door looks like its from Whoville…(the grinch).[/quote]

Hah thanks, I just moved in from my old room actually, and the reason why I wanted to do this mainly is because my mummy said I can completely redesign all the colours and whatnot, get new furniture etc, so I thought I’d try out some colours using CGI, to help me choose. :o
It will look lifelike when I’m done with it, I hope.

Anyway, here’s a photo of my door, it does look like it.

Read full topic
